authorization_policy_creation.name: authorization_policy_creation
authorization_policy_creation.description: Disable Toolchain Service to Secrets Manager Service authorization policy creation. To disable set the value to `disabled`. This applies to the CI, CD, and CC toolchains. To set separately, see `ci_authorization_policy_creation`, `cd_authorization_policy_creation`, and `cc_authorization_policy_creation`.

cc_opt_in_dynamic_ui_scan.description: To enable the OWASP Zap UI scan. '1' enable or '0' disable.

cc_peer_review_compliance.description: Set to `0` to disable. Set to `1` to enable peer review evidence collection.

cc_sonarqube_config.description: Runs a SonarQube scan in an isolated Docker-in-Docker container (default configuration) or in an existing Kubernetes cluster (custom configuration). Options: default or custom. Default is default.

cc_toolchain_description.default: Toolchain created with terraform template for DevSecOps CC Best Practices.

ci_code_engine_region.description: The region to create/lookup for the Code Engine project.

ci_code_engine_resource_group.name: ci_code_engine_resource_group
ci_code_engine_resource_group.description: The resource group of the Code Engine project.

ci_code_engine_source.name: ci_code_engine_source
ci_code_engine_source.description: The path to the location of code to build in the repository.

ci_compliance_base_image.name: ci_compliance_base_image
ci_compliance_base_image.description: Pipeline baseimage to run most of the built-in pipeline code.

ci_compliance_pipeline_group.name: ci_compliance_pipeline_group
ci_compliance_pipeline_group.description: Specify user or group for compliance pipline repo.

ci_compliance_pipeline_repo_auth_type.name: ci_compliance_pipeline_repo_auth_type
ci_compliance_pipeline_repo_auth_type.description: Select the method of authentication that is used to access the Git provider. 'oauth' or 'pat'.

ci_compliance_pipeline_repo_git_token_se.name: ci_compliance_pipeline_repo_git_token_secret_name
ci_compliance_pipeline_repo_git_token_se.description: Name of the Git token secret in the secret provider.

ci_cos_api_key_secret_name.name: ci_cos_api_key_secret_name
ci_cos_api_key_secret_name.description: Name of the COS API key secret in the secret provider.

ci_cra_generate_cyclonedx_format.name: ci_cra_generate_cyclonedx_format
ci_cra_generate_cyclonedx_format.description: If set to 1, CRA also generates the BOM in cyclonedx format (defaults to 1).

ci_custom_image_tag.name: ci_custom_image_tag
ci_custom_image_tag.description: The custom tag for the image in a comma-separated list.

ci_deployment_target.name: ci_deployment_target
ci_deployment_target.description: The deployment target, cluster or code-engine.

ci_dev_region.name: ci_dev_region
ci_dev_region.description: (Deprecated. Use `ci_cluster_region`) Region of the Kubernetes cluster where the application is deployed. Use the short form of the regions. For example `us-south`

ci_doi_toolchain_id.name: ci_doi_toolchain_id
ci_doi_toolchain_id.description: DevOps Insights toolchain ID to link to.

ci_doi_toolchain_id_pipeline_property.name: ci_doi_toolchain_id_pipeline_property
ci_doi_toolchain_id_pipeline_property.description: The DevOps Insights instance toolchain ID.

ci_enable_key_protect.name: ci_enable_key_protect
ci_enable_key_protect.description: Set to enable Key Protect Integration.

ci_enable_pipeline_dockerconfigjson.name: ci_enable_pipeline_dockerconfigjson
ci_enable_pipeline_dockerconfigjson.description: Enable to add the pipeline-dockerconfigjson property to the pipeline properties.

ci_enable_secrets_manager.name: ci_enable_secrets_manager
ci_enable_secrets_manager.description: Set to enable Secrets Manager Integration.

ci_enable_slack.name: ci_enable_slack
ci_enable_slack.description: Default: false. Set to true to create the integration.

ci_evidence_group.name: ci_evidence_group
ci_evidence_group.description: Specify Git user or group for evidence repository.

ci_evidence_repo_auth_type.name: ci_evidence_repo_auth_type
ci_evidence_repo_auth_type.description: Select the method of authentication that is used to access the Git provider. 'oauth' or 'pat'.

ci_evidence_repo_git_token_secret_name.name: ci_evidence_repo_git_token_secret_name
ci_evidence_repo_git_token_secret_name.description: Name of the Git token secret in the secret provider.

ci_inventory_group.name: ci_inventory_group
ci_inventory_group.description: Specify Git user or group for inventory repository.

ci_inventory_repo_auth_type.name: ci_inventory_repo_auth_type
ci_inventory_repo_auth_type.description: Select the method of authentication that is used to access the Git provider. 'oauth' or 'pat'.

ci_inventory_repo_git_token_secret_name.name: ci_inventory_repo_git_token_secret_name
ci_inventory_repo_git_token_secret_name.description: Name of the Git token secret in the secret provider.

ci_issues_group.name: ci_issues_group
ci_issues_group.description: Specify Git user or group for issues repository.

ci_issues_repo_auth_type.name: ci_issues_repo_auth_type
ci_issues_repo_auth_type.description: Select the method of authentication that is used to access the Git provider. 'oauth' or 'pat'.

ci_issues_repo_git_token_secret_name.name: ci_issues_repo_git_token_secret_name
ci_issues_repo_git_token_secret_name.description: Name of the Git token secret in the secret provider.

ci_kp_location.name: ci_kp_location
ci_kp_location.description: IBM Cloud location/region containing the Key Protect instance.

ci_kp_name.name: ci_kp_name
ci_kp_name.description: Name of the Key Protect instance where the secrets are stored.

ci_kp_resource_group.name: ci_kp_resource_group
ci_kp_resource_group.description: The resource group containing the Key Protect instance.

ci_link_to_doi_toolchain.name: ci_link_to_doi_toolchain
ci_link_to_doi_toolchain.description: Enable a link to a DevOps Insights instance in another toolchain.

ci_opt_in_dynamic_api_scan.name: ci_opt_in_dynamic_api_scan
ci_opt_in_dynamic_api_scan.description: To enable the OWASP Zap API scan. '1' enable or '0' disable.

ci_opt_in_dynamic_scan.name: ci_opt_in_dynamic_scan
ci_opt_in_dynamic_scan.description: To enable the OWASP Zap scan. '1' enable or '0' disable.

ci_opt_in_dynamic_ui_scan.name: ci_opt_in_dynamic_ui_scan
ci_opt_in_dynamic_ui_scan.description: To enable the OWASP Zap UI scan. '1' enable or '0' disable.

ci_peer_review_compliance.name: ci_peer_review_compliance
ci_peer_review_compliance.description: Set to `0` to disable. Set to `1` to enable peer review evidence collection.

ci_pipeline_config_group.name: ci_pipeline_config_group
ci_pipeline_config_group.description: Specify user or group for pipeline config repo.

ci_pipeline_config_path.name: ci_pipeline_config_path
ci_pipeline_config_path.description: The name and path of the pipeline-config.yaml file within the pipeline-config repo.

ci_pipeline_config_repo_auth_type.name: ci_pipeline_config_repo_auth_type
ci_pipeline_config_repo_auth_type.description: Select the method of authentication that is used to access the Git provider. 'oauth' or 'pat'.

ci_pipeline_config_repo_branch.name: ci_pipeline_config_repo_branch
ci_pipeline_config_repo_branch.description: Specify the branch containing the custom pipeline-config.yaml file.

ci_pipeline_config_repo_clone_from_url.name: ci_pipeline_config_repo_clone_from_url
ci_pipeline_config_repo_clone_from_url.description: Specify a repository containing a custom pipeline-config.yaml file.

ci_pipeline_config_repo_existing_url.name: ci_pipeline_config_repo_existing_url
ci_pipeline_config_repo_existing_url.description: Specify a repository containing a custom pipeline-config.yaml file.

ci_pipeline_config_repo_git_token_secret.name: ci_pipeline_config_repo_git_token_secret_name
ci_pipeline_config_repo_git_token_secret.description: Name of the Git token secret in the secret provider.

ci_pipeline_debug.name: ci_pipeline_debug
ci_pipeline_debug.description: '0' by default. Set to '1' to enable debug logging.

ci_pipeline_dockerconfigjson_secret_name.name: ci_pipeline_dockerconfigjson_secret_name
ci_pipeline_dockerconfigjson_secret_name.description: Name of the pipeline docker config JSON secret in the secret provider.

ci_pipeline_ibmcloud_api_key_secret_name.name: ci_pipeline_ibmcloud_api_key_secret_name
ci_pipeline_ibmcloud_api_key_secret_name.description: Name of the Cloud API key secret in the secret provider.

ci_registry_namespace.name: ci_registry_namespace
ci_registry_namespace.description: A unique namespace within the IBM Cloud Container Registry region where the application image is stored. (deprecated. Use `registry_namespace`)

ci_registry_region.name: ci_registry_region
ci_registry_region.description: The IBM Cloud Region where the IBM Cloud Container Registry namespace is to be created. Use the short form of the regions. For example `us-south`.

ci_repositories_prefix.name: ci_repositories_prefix
ci_repositories_prefix.description: Prefix name for the cloned compliance repos.

ci_signing_key_secret_name.name: ci_signing_key_secret_name
ci_signing_key_secret_name.description: Name of the signing key secret in the secret provider.

ci_slack_channel_name.name: ci_slack_channel_name
ci_slack_channel_name.description: The Slack channel that notifications are posted to.

ci_slack_notifications.name: ci_slack_notifications
ci_slack_notifications.description: The switch that turns the Slack notification on (`1`) or off (`0`).

ci_slack_team_name.name: ci_slack_team_name
ci_slack_team_name.description: The Slack team name, which is the word or phrase before `.slack.com` in the team URL.

ci_slack_toolchain_bind.name: ci_slack_toolchain_bind
ci_slack_toolchain_bind.description: Generate tool added to toolchain notifications.

ci_slack_toolchain_unbind.name: ci_slack_toolchain_unbind
ci_slack_toolchain_unbind.description: Generate tool removed from toolchain notifications.

ci_slack_webhook_secret_name.name: ci_slack_webhook_secret_name
ci_slack_webhook_secret_name.description: Name of the webhook secret in the secret provider.

ci_sm_location.name: ci_sm_location
ci_sm_location.description: IBM Cloud location/region containing the Secrets Manager instance.

ci_sm_name.name: ci_sm_name
ci_sm_name.description: Name of the Secrets Manager instance where the secrets are stored.

ci_sm_resource_group.name: ci_sm_resource_group
ci_sm_resource_group.description: The resource group containing the Secrets Manager instance.

ci_sm_secret_group.name: ci_sm_secret_group
ci_sm_secret_group.description: Group in Secrets Manager for organizing/grouping secrets.

ci_sonarqube_config.name: ci_sonarqube_config
ci_sonarqube_config.description: Runs a SonarQube scan in an isolated Docker-in-Docker container (default configuration) or in an existing Kubernetes cluster (custom configuration). Options: default or custom. Default is default.

ci_toolchain_description.name: ci_toolchain_description
ci_toolchain_description.default: Toolchain created with terraform template for DevSecOps CI Best Practices.

ci_toolchain_name.name: ci_toolchain_name
ci_toolchain_name.description: The name of the CI Toolchain.

ci_toolchain_region.name: ci_toolchain_region
ci_toolchain_region.description: The region containing the CI toolchain. Use the short form of the regions. For example `us-south`.

ci_toolchain_resource_group.name: ci_toolchain_resource_group
ci_toolchain_resource_group.description: The resource group within which the toolchain is created.

cluster_name.name: cluster_name
cluster_name.description: Name of the Kubernetes cluster where the application is deployed. This sets the same cluster for both CI and CD toolchains. See `ci_cluster_name` and `cd_cluster_name` to set different clusters. By default , the cluster namespace for CI will be set to `dev` and CD to `prod`. These can be changed using `ci_cluster_namespace` and `cd_cluster_namespace`.

compliance_base_image.name: compliance_base_image
compliance_base_image.description: Pipeline baseimage to run most of the built-in pipeline code.

cos_api_key_secret_name.name: cos_api_key_secret_name
cos_api_key_secret_name.description: To enable the use of COS, a secret name to a COS API key secret in the secret provider is required. In addition `cos_endpoint` and `cos_bucket_name` must be set. This setting sets the same API key for the COS settings in the CI, CD, and CC toolchains. See `ci_cos_api_key_secret_name`, `cd_cos_api_key_secret_name`, and `cc_cos_api_key_secret_name` to set separately.

cos_bucket_name.name: cos_bucket_name
cos_bucket_name.description: Set the name of your COS bucket. This applies the same COS bucket name for the CI, CD, and CC toolchains. See `ci_cos_bucket_name`, `cd_cos_bucket_name`, and `cc_cos_bucket_name` to set separately.

cos_endpoint.name: cos_endpoint
cos_endpoint.description: Set the Cloud Object Storage endpoint for accessing your COS bucket. This setting sets the same endpoint for COS in the CI, CD, and CC toolchains. See `ci_cos_endpoint`, `cd_cos_endpoint`, and `cc_cos_endpoint` to set the endpoints separately.

create_cc_toolchain.name: create_cc_toolchain
create_cc_toolchain.description: Boolean flag which determines if the DevSecOps CC toolchain is created.

create_cd_toolchain.name: create_cd_toolchain
create_cd_toolchain.description: Boolean flag which determines if the DevSecOps CD toolchain is created.

create_ci_toolchain.name: create_ci_toolchain
create_ci_toolchain.description: Flag which determines if the DevSecOps CI toolchain is created. If this toolchain is not created then values must be set for the following variables, evidence_repo_url, issues_repo_url and inventory_repo_url.

deployment_repo_url.name: deployment_repo_url
deployment_repo_url.description: This is the repository to clone deployment for DevSecOps toolchain template.

enable_key_protect.name: enable_key_protect
enable_key_protect.description: Set to enable Key Protect Integrations.

enable_slack.name: enable_slack
enable_slack.description: Set to `true` to create the integration. This requires a valid `slack_channel_name`, `slack_team_name`, and a valid `webhook` (see `slack_webhook_secret_name`). This setting applies for CI, CD, and CC toolchains. To enable Slack separately, see `ci_enable_slack`, `cd_enable_slack`, and `cc_enable_slack`.

environment_prefix.name: environment_prefix
environment_prefix.description: By default `ibm:yp:`. This will be set as the prefix to regions automatically where required. For example `ibm:yp:us-south`.

evidence_repo_url.name: evidence_repo_url
evidence_repo_url.description: This is a template repository to clone compliance-evidence-locker for reference DevSecOps toolchain templates.

ibmcloud_api_key.name: ibmcloud_api_key
ibmcloud_api_key.description: API key used to create the toolchains. (See deployment guide.)

inventory_repo_url.name: inventory_repo_url
inventory_repo_url.description: This is a template repository to clone compliance-inventory for reference DevSecOps toolchain templates.

issues_repo_url.name: issues_repo_url
issues_repo_url.description: This is a template repository to clone compliance-issues for reference DevSecOps toolchain templates.

kp_location.name: kp_location
kp_location.description: The region location of the Key Protect instance. This applies to the CI, CD and CC Key Protect integrations. See `ci_kp_location`, `cd_kp_location`, and `cc_kp_location` to set separately.

kp_name.name: kp_name
kp_name.description: Name of the Key Protect instance where the secrets are stored. This applies to the CI, CD and CC Key Protect integrations. See `ci_kp_name`, `cd_kp_name`, and `cc_kp_name` to set separately.

kp_resource_group.name: kp_resource_group
kp_resource_group.description: The resource group containing the Key Protect instance. This applies to the CI, CD and CC Key Protect integrations. See `ci_kp_resource_group`, `cd_kp_resource_group`, and `cc_kp_resource_group` to set separately.

peer_review_compliance.name: peer_review_compliance
peer_review_compliance.description: Set to `0` to disable. Set to `1` to enable peer review evidence collection. This parameter will apply to the CI, CD and CC pipelines. Can be set individually with `ci_peer_review_compliance`, `cd_peer_review_compliance`, `cc_peer_review_compliance`.

registry_namespace.name: registry_namespace
registry_namespace.description: A unique namespace within the IBM Cloud Container Registry region where the application image is stored.

repo_git_token_secret_name.name: repo_git_token_secret_name
repo_git_token_secret_name.description: Name of the Git token secret in the secret provider. Specifying a secret name for the Git Token automatically sets the authentication type to `pat`.

repo_group.name: repo_group
repo_group.description: Specify Git user or group for your application. This must be set if the repository authentication type is `pat` (personal access token).

repositories_prefix.name: repositories_prefix
repositories_prefix.description: Prefix name for the cloned compliance repos.

slack_channel_name.name: slack_channel_name
slack_channel_name.description: The Slack channel that notifications are posted to. This applies to the CI, CD, and CC toolchains. To set separately see `ci_slack_channel_name`, `cd_slack_channel_name`, and `cc_slack_channel_name`

slack_notifications.name: slack_notifications
slack_notifications.description: This is enabled automatically when a Slack integration is created. The switch overrides the Slack notifications. Set `1` for on and `0` for off. This applies to the CI, CD, and CC toolchains. To set separately, see `ci_slack_notifications`, `cd_slack_notifications`, and `cc_slack_notifications`.

slack_team_name.name: slack_team_name
slack_team_name.description: The Slack team name, which is the word or phrase before `.slack.com` in the team URL. This applies to the CI, CD, and CC toolchains. To set separately, see `ci_slack_team_name`, `cd_slack_team_name`, and `cc_slack_team_name`.

slack_webhook_secret_name.name: slack_webhook_secret_name
slack_webhook_secret_name.description: Name of the webhook secret for Slack in the secret provider. This applies to the CI, CD, and CC toolchains. To set separately, see `ci_slack_webhook_secret_name`, `cd_slack_webhook_secret_name`, and `cc_slack_webhook_secret_name`

sm_location.name: sm_location
sm_location.description: The region location of the Secrets Manager instance. This applies to the CI, CD and CC Secret Manager integrations. See `ci_sm_location`, `cd_sm_location`, and `cc_sm_location` to set separately.

sm_name.name: sm_name
sm_name.description: The name of the Secret Managers instance. This applies to the CI, CD and CC Secret Manager integrations. See `ci_sm_name`, `cd_sm_name`, and `cc_sm_name` to set separately.

sm_resource_group.name: sm_resource_group
sm_resource_group.description: The resource group containing the Secrets Manager instance. This applies to the CI, CD and CC Secret Manager integrations. See `ci_sm_resource_group`, `cd_sm_resource_group`, and `cc_sm_resource_group` to set separately.

sm_secret_group.name: sm_secret_group
sm_secret_group.description: Group in Secrets Manager for organizing/grouping secrets. This applies to the CI, CD and CC Secret Manager integrations. See `ci_sm_secret_group`, `cd_sm_secret_group`, and `cc_sm_secret_group` to set separately.

toolchain_name.name: toolchain_name
toolchain_name.description: Common element of the toolchain name. The toolchain names will be appended with `CI Toolchain` or `CD Toolchain` or `CC Toolchain` followed by a timestamp. Can explicitly be set using `ci_toolchain_name`, `cd_toolchain_name`, and `cc_toolchain_name`.

toolchain_region.name: toolchain_region
toolchain_region.description: The region identifier that will be used, by default, for all resource creation and service instance lookup. This can be overridden on a per resource/service basis. See `ci_toolchain_region`,`cd_toolchain_region`,`cc_toolchain_region`, `ci_cluster_region`, `cd_cluster_region`, `ci_registry_region`.

toolchain_resource_group.name: toolchain_resource_group
toolchain_resource_group.description: The resource group that will be used, by default, for all resource creation and service instance lookups. This can be overridden on a per resource/service basis. See `ci_toolchain_resource_group`,`cd_toolchain_resource_group`,`cc_toolchain_resource_group`, `ci_cluster_resource_group`.

compliance_cc_toolchain_id.name: compliance_cc_toolchain_id
compliance_cc_toolchain_id.description: The ID of the Compliance CC Toolchain

compliance_cd_toolchain_id.name: compliance_cd_toolchain_id
compliance_cd_toolchain_id.description: The ID of the Compliance CD Toolchain

compliance_ci_toolchain_id.name: compliance_ci_toolchain_id
compliance_ci_toolchain_id.description: The ID of the Compliance CI Toolchain

key_protect_instance_id.name: kp_instance_guid
key_protect_instance_id.description: GUID of the Key Protect service instance in IBM Cloud

pipeline_repo_url.name: pipeline_repo_url
pipeline_repo_url.description: This repository url contains the tekton definitions for compliance pipelines

secrets_manager_instance_id.name: sm_instance_guid
secrets_manager_instance_id.description: GUID of the Secrets Manager service instance in IBM Cloud

deployment_repo_url.name: deployment_repo_url
deployment_repo_url.description: The deployment repository instance url containing an application that can be built and deployed with the reference DevSecOps toolchain templates.

key_protect_instance_id.name: kp_instance_guid
key_protect_instance_id.description: GUID of the Key Protect service instance in IBM Cloud

pipeline_repo_url.name: pipeline_repo_url
pipeline_repo_url.description: This repository url contains the tekton definitions for compliance pipelines

secret_tool.name: secret_tool
secret_tool.description: Used as part of secret references to point to the secret store tool integration

secrets_manager_instance_id.name: sm_instance_guid
secrets_manager_instance_id.description: GUID of the Secrets Manager service instance in IBM Cloud

app_repo_branch.name: app_repo_branch
app_repo_branch.description: The app repo default branch that will be used by the CI build, usually either main or master.

app_repo_url.name: app_repo_url
app_repo_url.description: The app repository instance url containing an application that can be built and deployed with the reference DevSecOps toolchain templates.

evidence_repo.name: evidence_repo
evidence_repo.description: The evidence repository instance url, where evidence of the builds and scans are stored, ready for any compliance audit

evidence_repo_url.name: evidence_repo_url
evidence_repo_url.description: The evidence repository instance url, where evidence of the builds and scans are stored, ready for any compliance audit

inventory_repo.name: inventory_repo
inventory_repo.description: The inventory repository instance url, with details of which artifact has been built and will be deployed

inventory_repo_url.name: inventory_repo_url
inventory_repo_url.description: The inventory repository instance url, with details of which artifact has been built and will be deployed

issues_repo.name: issues_repo
issues_repo.description: The incident issues repository instance url, where issues are created when vulnerabilities and CVEs are detected

issues_repo_url.name: issues_repo_url
issues_repo_url.description: The incident issues repository instance url, where issues are created when vulnerabilities and CVEs are detected

key_protect_instance_id.name: kp_instance_guid
key_protect_instance_id.description: GUID of the Key Protect service instance in IBM Cloud

pipeline_repo_url.name: pipeline_repo_url
pipeline_repo_url.description: This repository url contains the tekton definitions for compliance pipelines

secret_tool.name: secret_tool
secret_tool.description: Used as part of secret references to point to the secret store tool integration

secrets_manager_instance_id.name: sm_instance_guid
secrets_manager_instance_id.description: GUID of the Secrets Manager service instance in IBM Cloud
